skill.name: calculator
skill.description: Performs arbitrary-precision arithmetic calculations including addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and exponents. Use when the user asks to calculate, compute, or evaluate math expressions, or when precise decimal arithmetic is needed to avoid floating-point errors.
skill.summary: Performs arbitrary-precision arithmetic calculations including addition, subtraction, multiplication...

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate calculator skill with no network access or file I/O. The only risk factors are npm script definitions and Node.js command execution for running the calculator itself. The code uses the shunting-yard algorithm for expression parsing and big.js for arbitrary-precision arithmetic. No obfuscation, no data exfiltration, no malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Avoid floating-point errors in financial and scientific calculations. This skill evaluates math expressions with arbitrary precision using big.js.
actual_capabilities: Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, division with arbitrary precision
Handle parentheses and operator precedence correctly
Support negative numbers and decimal values
limitations: No factorial, modulo, or bitwise operators

use_cases.title: Calculate precise financial figures
use_cases.description: Calculate taxes, interest, and budgets without floating-point rounding errors

use_cases.title: Evaluate arithmetic expressions
use_cases.description: Compute complex math expressions in code without precision loss

use_cases.title: Verify math homework
use_cases.description: Check arithmetic problems with exact decimal results

best_practices: Use for financial calculations where precision matters
Wrap expressions in quotes when passing as arguments
anti_patterns: Do not use for trigonometric functions or symbolic math
Do not expect variable support in expressions
Do not use for factorial or modulo operations

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires Node.js and npm installed on the system.

faq.question: What is the maximum number size?
faq.answer: Uses big.js which supports arbitrarily large integers limited only by available system memory.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my workflow?
faq.answer: Invoke the Calculator skill with any arithmetic expression. It handles operator precedence automatically.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill runs locally with no network access. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why is 0.1 + 0.2 not 0.3 in standard math?
faq.answer: Binary floating-point representation causes rounding errors. This skill uses decimal arithmetic to avoid that issue.

faq.question: How is this different from using eval()?
faq.answer: This skill uses a safe parsing algorithm. It never executes arbitrary code and handles precision correctly.
